alert.note: Alert for Coastal Charlotte; Highlands; Inland Charlotte (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 03 at 11:42PM EDT until further notice by NWS Tampa Bay
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Florida and west central Florida, including the following areas, in southwest Florida, Coastal Charlotte, Coastal Lee, Inland Charlotte and Inland Lee. In west central Florida, Coastal Sarasota, DeSoto, Highlands and Inland Sarasota. * WHEN...Through Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Potential tropical cyclone one will continue to spread locally heavy rain across portions of west central and southwest Florida tonight and Saturday. Storm total rainfall amounts of 4 to 8 inches is possible, with the highest amounts over southwest Florida. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
